name: RFL-2 "Calciner"
description: The Calciner is a second-generation lithic facility built around a multi-zone tunnel furnace with independently controlled temperature profiles in each zone — a design borrowed from modern structural-ceramic and glass-ceramic manufacturing. The real capability advance over the Sagger is the addition of a sol-gel wet chemistry module: silicate feedstock can be dissolved, purified by selective precipitation, and re-dried into extremely pure precursor powders before thermal processing. This purity unlock is what enables semiconductor-grade silicon carbide and silicon nitride production (semiconductor_materials). The two-chamber design runs one batch through wet prep while a second is in the thermal stage, doubling effective throughput. A 8% feedstock recovery improvement over the Sagger comes from recapturing calcination off-gases and recycling their condensate back into the sol-gel loop — a process first demonstrated on Earth in the alumina refining industry and adapted here for in-situ resource utilization. Power draw includes resistive heating elements, the wet-chemistry pumps, and the gas-handling system for off-gas recovery.
